newsitem.title: USA: Fractal Design sees Q4 shr loss $0.01-$0.05.
newsitem.headline: Fractal Design sees Q4 shr loss $0.01-$0.05.

text.p: Fractal Design Corp said on Monday it expected to report a net loss between $0.01 per share and $0.05 per share for the fourth quarter on revenues of between $6.7 million and $7.2 million.

The company said lower fourth quarter results were due to lower-than-anticipated order volume and an unexpected disruption at its manufacturing and fulfillment provider. Because of the disruption, up to $2 million in customer orders were not shipped before the quarter closed, the company said.
The First Call consensus earnings estimate for the fourth quarter was a profit of $0.08 per share versus a profit of $0.10 per share in the year-ago fourth quarter.

Fractal said its sole third-party manufacturing and fulfillment provider ceased operations unexpectedly near the end of the quarter. Although Fractal said it was able to relocate its inventory and resume manufacturing elsewhere, it realized $2 million in orders were not shipped before the end of the quarter.
The company said it believed it would have reported a profit for the March quarter if the orders had been shipped.
The manufacturer has been told to ship the remaining orders as quickly as possible, the company said.
As previously announced, the proposed merger of Fractal and MetaTools Inc was expected to be submitted to shareholder votes before the end of May 1997.
Final results were due to be announced between April 28 and May 5, Fractal said.
